title: How to Make Braided Hair Accessories

steps.headline: Measure out a length for making the braid with.
steps.description: Remember that when you make a braid, each length of yarn will shorten considerably, so double the length at a minimum.

steps.headline: Choose the thread colors.
steps.description: The three colors should complement or match each other and it's ideal if they are intended for certain color schemes within your own wardrobe.

steps.headline: Align the three threads together.
steps.description: Place them side by side with care, so that they meet up together.

steps.headline: Tie a knot about one inch from the end of the thread lengths.
steps.description: This will keep the three lengths together evenly while braiding.

steps.headline: Begin braiding.
steps.description: Braid from the knot down the length of the yarn.

steps.headline: Stop when you reach the desired length.
steps.description: This length can be ascertained from the length of the clip, barrette or other hair accessory you're going to be adding the design to.

steps.headline: Tie another knot at the end of the braiding.
steps.description: This will prevent the braid from unraveling. The braid piece is now ready to be attached to the hair accessory.

parts.name: Attaching the braided piece to the hair accessory

steps.headline: Ensure that the surface of the hair accessory is clean and dry.
steps.description: If it isn't clean, remove any dust or grime first, and allow to fully dry before proceeding.

steps.headline: Use a strong glue to attach the braid to the hair accessory surface.
steps.description: Add glue to the accessory's surface first, then align the piece of braid to the surface. In some cases, you may find that it also helps to add the glue to the braid as well as to the surface of the hair accessory. Be sure to use glue that is suitable for both the yarn (fabric) and for the hair accessory.

steps.headline: Allow the glue to dry completely.
Add a sealant layer.
steps.description: This might be a spray-on varnish or a brush of Mod Podge. This is to protect the surface from wear and tear.

Choose the thread colors. The three colors should complement or match each other and it's ideal if they are intended for certain color schemes within your own wardrobe. Align the three threads together. Place them side by side with care, so that they meet up together. Tie a knot about one inch from the end of the thread lengths. This will keep the three lengths together evenly while braiding. Begin braiding. Braid from the knot down the length of the yarn. Stop when you reach the desired length. This length can be ascertained from the length of the clip, barrette or other hair accessory you're going to be adding the design to. Tie another knot at the end of the braiding. This will prevent the braid from unraveling. The braid piece is now ready to be attached to the hair accessory. Attaching the braided piece to the hair accessory Ensure that the surface of the hair accessory is clean and dry. If it isn't clean, remove any dust or grime first, and allow to fully dry before proceeding. Use a strong glue to attach the braid to the hair accessory surface. Add glue to the accessory's surface first, then align the piece of braid to the surface. In some cases, you may find that it also helps to add the glue to the braid as well as to the surface of the hair accessory. Be sure to use glue that is suitable for both the yarn (fabric) and for the hair accessory. Allow the glue to dry completely.  Add a sealant layer. This might be a spray-on varnish or a brush of Mod Podge. This is to protect the surface from wear and tear.
